Package paintingcanvas.painter

Class App.SimpleElement<T extends App.SimpleElement<T>>

java.lang.Object
paintingcanvas.painter.App.SimpleElement<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The class of the element extending App.SimpleElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
App.Circle, App.Ellipse, App.Polygon, App.Rectangle, App.Square, App.Text, App.Triangle
Enclosing class:
App
protected abstract static class App.SimpleElement<T extends App.SimpleElement<T>> extends Object
A wrapper over a Drawable with an easier to use API

    • setColor

      public T setColor(int r, int g, int b)
      Set the color of the element with RGB. 
      
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);
 o.setColor(255, 0, 0); // Set color to red
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of the color (0-255)
      g - The green component of the color (0-255)
      b - The blue component of the color (0-255)
      Returns:
      The original object to allow method chaining

    • setColor

      public T setColor(Color color)
      Set the color of the object with a Color object. 
      
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);
 o.setColor(Color.RED); // Set color to red
      Parameters:
      color - color.
      Returns:
      The original object to allow method chaining

    • setColor

      public T setColor(int hex)
      Set the color of the object with a 8-bit RGB hex literal. 
      
     Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);
 // 0xFF0000 is hex for (255, 0, 0), which is red
 o.setColor(0xFF0000);
      Parameters:
      hex - The color as a hex literal
      Returns:
      The original object to allow method chaining

    • rotate

      public T rotate(double rotation)
      Rotate this element by rotation°. 
      
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);

 // Calling rotate(90) twice makes the object rotate 180°
 o.rotate(90);
 o.rotate(90);
      Parameters:
      rotation - Change in rotation. (Degrees)
      Returns:
      The original object to allow method chaining
      See Also:
      • rotateTo(double)

    • rotateTo

      public T rotateTo(double rotation)
      Set an elements rotation to rotation°. 
      
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);
 o.rotate(90); // Sets the elements rotation to 90°
      Parameters:
      rotation - Absolute rotation. (Degrees)
      Returns:
      The original object to allow method chaining
      See Also:
      • rotate(double)

    • animate

      public App.AnimationBuilder animate()
      Create an App.AnimationBuilder. Used to animate different propertys of an element (position, rotation, color). 
      
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);

 // Animate Circle o to move to 200, 200 for 3 seconds
 o.animate().add(moveTo(200, 200), 3);
      Returns:
      App.AnimationBuilder
